title: Bar's secret code to help women feeling "unsafe" on Tinder dates 'not going well'
text:
News Bar's secret code to help women feeling "unsafe" on Tinder dates 'not going well' The drink is called an Angel Shot in the poster appearing globally but variations can also include asking for a particular woman's name Share Hooters, normally known for its busty scantily clad staff, has been praised for its efforts in helping female customers (Photo: Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! It's the one drink you don't want your new date to order during your first rendezvous. 
A secret drink code called an"Angel Shot" has gone viral on the internet outlining how bars around the world are giving women a escape route during a threatening or uncomfortable date . 
Amid the growth of dating apps such as Tinder, restaurants and bar are increasingly installing signs in female toilets outlining how to get help from staff if they require it. 
Renaldo Guows posted a photo of the sign in a South African Hooters bar on Facebook in a post shared more than 60,000 times. One of the signs seen in South Africa that have also appeared in the US (Photo: Facebook) 
"Is your Tinder or Plenty of Fish date not who they said they were on their profile?" the sign said. 
"Do you feel unsafe, or even just a little bit weird? We're here to help. Just go to the bar and order an angel shot." 
A shot ordered neat will tell the bartender you want o be escorted to your vehicle. 
If you order it with ice, the bartender will call Uber or Lyft for you. 
And, if things are going really bad, just ask for a lime and the bartender will call the police. 
"We'll handle things discreetly, and without a lot of fuss. (We've been there and we want you to know that you're in good hands." Read More These are officially the most attractive people on Tinder - according to all their 'right swipes' 
It is not the first bar to post the message after the same sign appeared in a Tampa Bay, Florida, bar called Iberian Rooster over Christmas. 
In the UK, The Brickyard in St Albans had a similar sign for Tinder dates telling punters to ask for Rachelle or Jennifer and they would find a taxi for them, Metro reports. 
The Lincolnshire Rape Crisis group also recently ran a campaign to prevent attacks - telling women to ask for Angela at the bar. Read More 
Mr Guows said in his Hooters post: "This has been put up in the Ladies bathroom. 
"Very cool initiative from Hooters South Africa. Respect!" 
(Side Note : Posting this on Facebook doesn't change the fact that a lady can go to the bar and order this shot after seeing this in the bathroom. 
"It's not supposed to be a secret, it's spreading awareness.)" Like us on Facebook
